maml:description.maml:para: Create an autoscale setting.
Create an autoscale setting.
An object specifying an autoscale setting. This type of object can be obtained from the Get-AzureRmAutoscaleSetting or it can be constructed in a PowerShell script.
The resource group of the resource associated to the autoscale setting.
Flag to disable an existing autoscale setting.
List of profiles to add to the autoscale setting or null if no profile should be added.
List of comma-separated notifications
The location of the autoscale setting.
The name of the autoscale setting.
The resource group of the resource associated to the autoscale setting.
Flag to disable an existing autoscale setting.
List of profiles to add to the autoscale setting or null if no profile should be added.
The resource Id of the resource to auto scale.
List of comma-separated notifications
An object specifying an autoscale setting. This type of object can be obtained from the Get-AzureRmAutoscaleSetting or it can be constructed in a PowerShell script.
The resource group of the resource associated to the autoscale setting.
Flag to disable an existing autoscale setting.
List of profiles to add to the autoscale setting or null if no profile should be added.
List of comma-separated notifications
The location of the autoscale setting.
The name of the autoscale setting.
The resource Id of the resource to auto scale.

maml:alert.maml:para: Keywords: azure, azurerm, arm, resource, management, manager, insights

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1: Create autoscale setting --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
$rule1 = New-AzureRmAutoscaleRule -MetricName Requests -MetricResourceId "/subscriptions/b93fb07a-6f93-30be-bf3e-4f0deca15f4f/resourceGroups/Default-Web-EastUS/providers/microsoft.web/sites/mywebsite" -Operator GreaterThan -MetricStatistic Average -Threshold 10 -TimeGrain 00:01:00 -ScaleActionCooldown 00:05:00 -ScaleActionDirection Increase -ScaleActionScaleType ChangeCount -ScaleActionValue "1"
$rule2 = New-AzureRmAutoscaleRule -MetricName Requests -MetricResourceId "/subscriptions/b93fb07a-6f93-30be-bf3e-4f0deca15f4f/resourceGroups/Default-Web-EastUS/providers/microsoft.web/sites/mywebsite" -Operator GreaterThan -MetricStatistic Average -Threshold 10 -TimeGrain 00:01:00 -ScaleActionCooldown 00:10:00 -ScaleActionDirection Increase -ScaleActionScaleType ChangeCount -ScaleActionValue "2"
$profile1 = New-AzureRmAutoscaleProfile -DefaultCapacity "1" -MaximumCapacity "10" -MinimumCapacity "1" -StartTimeWindow 2015-03-05T14:00:00 -EndTimeWindow 2015-03-05T14:30:00 -TimeWindowTimeZone GMT -Rules $rule1, $rule2 -Name "adios"
$profile2 = New-AzureRmAutoscaleProfile -DefaultCapacity "1" -MaximumCapacity "10" -MinimumCapacity "1" -Rules $rule1, $rule2 -Name "secondProfileName" -RecurrenceFrequency Minute -ScheduleDays "1", "2", "3" -ScheduleHours 5, 10, 15 -ScheduleMinutes 15, 30, 45 -ScheduleTimeZone GMT
Add-AzureRmAutoscaleSetting -Location "East US" -Name MySetting -ResourceGroup Default-Web-EastUS -TargetResourceId /subscriptions/b93fb07a-6f93-30be-bf3e-4f0deca15f4f/resourceGroups/Default-Web-EastUS/providers/microsoft.web/serverFarms/DefaultServerFarm -AutoscaleProfiles $profile1, $profile2

maml:description.maml:para: Adds or replaces a log (event) alert rule
Adds or replaces an event alert rule. The added rule is associated to a resource group and has a name.
The resource group of the resource the rules is monitoring.
The id of the resource the rules is monitoring.
The level of the event the rule is monitoring. This is used only in the event-based rules.
The operation name
The resource provider of the resource the rules is monitoring.
The status
The substatus
The location where the rule is to be defined.
The description of the rule.
If present disables the rule. If absent the rule is enabled.
The resource group (name) of the rule
Name of the rule
Comma-separated list of actions
The resource group of the resource the rules is monitoring.
The id of the resource the rules is monitoring.
The level of the event the rule is monitoring. This is used only in the event-based rules.
The operation name
The resource provider of the resource the rules is monitoring.
The status
The substatus
The location where the rule is to be defined.
The description of the rule.
If present disables the rule. If absent the rule is enabled.
The resource group (name) of the rule
Name of the rule
Comma-separated list of actions

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1: AddAzureRmMetricAlertRule --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Add-AzureRMMetricAlertRule -Name chiricutin -Location "East US" -ResourceGroup Default-Web-EastUS -Operator GreaterThan -Threshold 2 -WindowSize 00:05:00 -ResourceId /subscriptions/a93fb07c-6c93-40be-bf3b-4f0deba10f4b/resourceGroups/Default-Web-EastUS/providers/microsoft.web/sites/mywebsite -MetricName Requests -Description "Pura Vida" -TimeAggre Total

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command creates a metric alert rule attached to a website

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2: AddAzureRmMetricAlertRule disabling a rule --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Add-AzureRMMetricAlertRule -Name chiricutin5 -Location "East US" -ResourceGroup Default-Web-EastUS -Operator GreaterThan -Threshold 2 -WindowSize 00:05:00 -ResourceId /subscriptions/b93fb07a-6f93-30be-bf3e-4f0deca15f4f/resourceGroups/Default-Web-EastUS/providers/microsoft.web/sites/mywebsite -MetricName Requests -TimeAggre Total -CustomE gu@macrosoft.com -send -disab

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command disables a rule. If the rule does not exist, it creates it disabled. If the rule exists, then it just disables it.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 3: AddAzureRmMetricAlertRule with some actions --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Add-AzureRmMetricAlertRule -Name metricRule5 -Location "East US" -ResourceGroup Default-Web-EastUS -Operator GreaterThan -Threshold 1 -ResourceId /subscriptions/b93fb07a-6f93-30be-bf3e-4f0deca15f4f/resourceGroups/Default-Web-EastUS/providers/microsoft.web/sites/mywebsite -MetricName Requests -TimeAggre Total

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command creates a metric alert rule attached to a website and with some e-mails to send notifications to.

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieves a log profile
Retrieves a log profile
The name of the profile
The name of the profile
Retrieves the metric values of a resource.
Retrieves the metric values of a resource that comply with certain criteria.
WARNING: This cmdlet will change in the next version. Both input and output are going to change.
The id of the resource the metric is associated to.
The time grain of the metric to be retrieve.
The metric's aggregation type. It can take one value of the following set: None, Average, Count, Minimum, Maximum, Total.
Specifies the start time of the query in local time. This parameter is optional. The default is EndTime minus one hour.
Specifies the end time of the query in local time. This parameter is optional. The default is the current time. The value must be later than StartTime.

Comma-separated list of metric names. This mandatory in the full parameter group call. If given, it enables all the other parameters, hence that is called a full parameter call. If not given, no other parameter is accepted. Note: the ResourceId parameter is always mandatory and enabled. DetailedOutput is always optional and always enabled.
If present it indicates that the output will be detailed. This parameter is optional. The default is no (i.e. summarized output.)
The id of the resource the metric is associated to.

Comma-separated list of metric names. This mandatory in the full parameter group call. If given, it enables all the other parameters, hence that is called a full parameter call. If not given, no other parameter is accepted. Note: the ResourceId parameter is always mandatory and enabled. DetailedOutput is always optional and always enabled.
If present it indicates that the output will be detailed. This parameter is optional. The default is no (i.e. summarized output.)
The id of the resource the metric is associated to.
The time grain of the metric to be retrieve.
The metric's aggregation type. It can take one value of the following set: None, Average, Count, Minimum, Maximum, Total.
Specifies the start time of the query in local time. This parameter is optional. The default is EndTime minus one hour.
Specifies the end time of the query in local time. This parameter is optional. The default is the current time. The value must be later than StartTime.

Comma-separated list of metric names. This mandatory in the full parameter group call. If given, it enables all the other parameters, hence that is called a full parameter call. If not given, no other parameter is accepted. Note: the ResourceId parameter is always mandatory and enabled. DetailedOutput is always optional and always enabled.
If present it indicates that the output will be detailed. This parameter is optional. The default is no (i.e. summarized output.)

maml:description.maml:para: Creates an autoscale profile.
Creates an autoscale profile.
The name of the profile.
The default capacity.
The maximum capacity.
The minimum capacity.
The start of the time window.
The end of the time window.
The time zone of the time window.
The list of rules to add to the newly created profile.
The name of the profile.
The default capacity.
The maximum capacity.
The minimum capacity.
The frequency of recurrence. The allowed values are: None, Second, Minute, Hour, Day, Week, Month, Year. Not all those values are supported.
A list of days scheduled.
A list of scheduled hours.
List of scheduled minutes.
The time zone of the schedule.
The list of rules to add to the newly created profile.
The name of the profile.
The default capacity.
The maximum capacity.
The minimum capacity.
The list of rules to add to the newly created profile.
The name of the profile.
The default capacity.
The maximum capacity.
The minimum capacity.
The start of the time window.
The end of the time window.
The time zone of the time window.
The list of rules to add to the newly created profile.
The frequency of recurrence. The allowed values are: None, Second, Minute, Hour, Day, Week, Month, Year. Not all those values are supported.
A list of days scheduled.
A list of scheduled hours.
List of scheduled minutes.
The time zone of the schedule.

maml:alert.maml:para: Keywords: azure, azurerm, arm, resource, management, manager, insights

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1: Create single profile, fixed date --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
$rule = New-AzureRmAutoscaleRule -MetricName Requests -MetricResourceId "/subscriptions/b93fb07a-6f93-30be-bf3e-4f0deca15f4f/resourceGroups/Default-Web-EastUS/providers/microsoft.web/sites/mywebsite" -Operator GreaterThan -MetricStatistic Average -Threshold 10 -TimeGrain 00:01:00 -ScaleActionCooldown 00:05:00 -ScaleActionDirection Increase -ScaleActionScaleType ChangeCount -ScaleActionValue "1"
$profile = New-AzureRmAutoscaleProfile -DefaultCapacity "1" -MaximumCapacity "10" -MinimumCapacity "1" -StartTimeWindow 2015-03-05T14:00:00 -EndTimeWindow 2015-03-05T14:30:00 -TimeWindowTimeZone GMT -Rules $rule -Name "adios"

dev:remarks.maml:para: Creates a single profile without a schedule (fix date)

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2: Create single profile with schedule --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
$rule = New-AzureRmAutoscaleRule -MetricName Requests -MetricResourceId "/subscriptions/b93fb07a-6f93-30be-bf3e-4f0deca15f4f/resourceGroups/Default-Web-EastUS/providers/microsoft.web/sites/mywebsite" -Operator GreaterThan -MetricStatistic Average -Threshold 10 -TimeGrain 00:01:00 -ScaleActionCooldown 00:05:00 -ScaleActionDirection Increase -ScaleActionScaleType ChangeCount -ScaleActionValue "1"
$profile = New-AzureRmAutoscaleProfile -DefaultCapacity "1" -MaximumCapacity "10" -MinimumCapacity "1" -Rules $rule -Name "secondProfileName" -RecurrenceFrequency Minute -ScheduleDays "1", "2", "3" -ScheduleHours 5, 10, 15 -ScheduleMinutes 15, 30, 45 -ScheduleTimeZone GMT

dev:remarks.maml:para: Creates a single profile with a recurrent schedule.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 3: Create two profiles --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
$rule1 = New-AzureRmAutoscaleRule -MetricName Requests -MetricResourceId "/subscriptions/b93fb07a-6f93-30be-bf3e-4f0deca15f4f/resourceGroups/Default-Web-EastUS/providers/microsoft.web/sites/mywebsite" -Operator GreaterThan -MetricStatistic Average -Threshold 10 -TimeGrain 00:01:00 -ScaleActionCooldown 00:05:00 -ScaleActionDirection Increase -ScaleActionScaleType ChangeCount -ScaleActionValue "1"
$rule2 = New-AzureRmAutoscaleRule -MetricName Requests -MetricResourceId "/subscriptions/b93fb07a-6f93-30be-bf3e-4f0deca15f4f/resourceGroups/Default-Web-EastUS/providers/microsoft.web/sites/mywebsite" -Operator GreaterThan -MetricStatistic Average -Threshold 10 -TimeGrain 00:01:00 -ScaleActionCooldown 00:10:00 -ScaleActionDirection Increase -ScaleActionScaleType ChangeCount -ScaleActionValue "2"
$profile1 = New-AzureRmAutoscaleProfile -DefaultCapacity "1" -MaximumCapacity "10" -MinimumCapacity "1" -StartTimeWindow 2015-03-05T14:00:00 -EndTimeWindow 2015-03-05T14:30:00 -TimeWindowTimeZone GMT -Rules $rule1, $rule2 -Name "profileName"
$profile2 = New-AzureRmAutoscaleProfile -DefaultCapacity "1" -MaximumCapacity "10" -MinimumCapacity "1" -Rules $rule1, $rule2 -Name "secondProfileName" -RecurrenceFrequency Week -ScheduleDays "1" -ScheduleHours 5 -ScheduleMinutes 15 -ScheduleTimeZone UTC

dev:remarks.maml:para: Creates two profiles adds them to a list.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 4: Create single profile, no scheduled time --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
$rule = New-AzureRmAutoscaleRule -MetricName Requests -MetricResourceId "/subscriptions/b93fb07a-6f93-30be-bf3e-4f0deca15f4f/resourceGroups/Default-Web-EastUS/providers/microsoft.web/sites/mywebsite" -Operator GreaterThan -MetricStatistic Average -Threshold 10 -TimeGrain 00:01:00 -ScaleActionCooldown 00:05:00 -ScaleActionDirection Increase -ScaleActionScaleType ChangeCount -ScaleActionValue "1"
$profile = New-AzureRmAutoscaleProfile -DefaultCapacity "1" -MaximumCapacity "10" -MinimumCapacity "1" -Rules $rule -Name "profileName"

dev:remarks.maml:para: Creates a single profile without a schedule or a fixed date

maml:description.maml:para: Create an autoscale rule.
Create an autoscale rule.
The metric name.
The metric resource Id.
The operator. Allowed values are: Equals, NotEquals, GreaterThan, GreaterThanOrEqual, LessThan, LessThanOrEqual
The metric statistic. The allowed values are: Average, Min, Max, Sum.
The threshold of the metric value.
The time aggregation operator. The allowed values are: Average, Minimum, Maximum, Last, Total, Count.
The time grain.
The time window.
Autoscale action cooldown time.
The scale action direction. The allowed values are: None, Increase, Decrease.
The scale type for the setting. It supports these values: ChangeCount (default), PercentChangeCount, ExactCount.
Indicates the size of the scale. It is intentionally left as string for future extension, but currently only numerals are accepted.
The metric name.
The metric resource Id.
The operator. Allowed values are: Equals, NotEquals, GreaterThan, GreaterThanOrEqual, LessThan, LessThanOrEqual
The metric statistic. The allowed values are: Average, Min, Max, Sum.
The threshold of the metric value.
The time aggregation operator. The allowed values are: Average, Minimum, Maximum, Last, Total, Count.
The time grain.
The time window.
Autoscale action cooldown time.
The scale action direction. The allowed values are: None, Increase, Decrease.
The scale type for the setting. It supports these values: ChangeCount (default), PercentChangeCount, ExactCount.
Indicates the size of the scale. It is intentionally left as string for future extension, but currently only numerals are accepted.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Creates a single rule.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2: Create two rules --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
$rule1 = New-AzureRmAutoscaleRule -MetricName Requests -MetricResourceId "/subscriptions/b93fb07a-6f93-30be-bf3e-4f0deca15f4f/resourceGroups/Default-Web-EastUS/providers/microsoft.web/sites/mywebsite" -Operator GreaterThan -MetricStatistic Average -Threshold 10 -TimeGrain 00:01:00 -ScaleActionCooldown 00:05:00 -ScaleActionDirection Increase -ScaleActionScaleType ChangeCount -ScaleActionValue "1"
$rule2 = New-AzureRmAutoscaleRule -MetricName Requests -MetricResourceId "/subscriptions/b93fb07a-6f93-30be-bf3e-4f0deca15f4f/resourceGroups/Default-Web-EastUS/providers/microsoft.web/sites/mywebsite" -Operator GreaterThan -MetricStatistic Average -Threshold 10 -TimeGrain 00:01:00 -ScaleActionCooldown 00:10:00 -ScaleActionDirection Increase -ScaleActionScaleType ChangeCount -ScaleActionValue "2"

dev:remarks.maml:para: Creates two rules.

maml:description.maml:para: Removes a log profile
Removes a log profile
The log profile name
The log profile name
Sets the logs and metrics settings for the resource.
This command enables or disables each timegrain and log category for the particular resource. The logs and metrics will be stored in the defined storage account.
The id of the resource.
The id of the storage account where the data will be saved to.
The Id of the service bus rule
The value indicating whether the diagnostics should be enabled or disabled
The list of log categories to be enabled or disabled, according to the value in -Enable. If no category is specified, this command assumes all categories.
The list of timegrains to be enabled or disabled for metrics, according to the value in -Enable. If no timegrain is specified, this command assumes all available timegrains.
Flag to enable/disable retention
The Id of the workspace
The number of retention days.
The id of the resource.
The id of the storage account where the data will be saved to.
The Id of the service bus rule
The value indicating whether the diagnostics should be enabled or disabled
The list of log categories to be enabled or disabled, according to the value in -Enable. If no category is specified, this command assumes all categories.
The list of timegrains to be enabled or disabled for metrics, according to the value in -Enable. If no timegrain is specified, this command assumes all available timegrains.
Flag to enable/disable retention
The Id of the workspace
The number of retention days.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This will enable all available metrics and logs for the resource.
This will disable all available metrics and logs for the resource <resourceName>.
This will enable only Category1 and Category2. All timegrains and other categories will remain the same.
This will enable only Category1, Category2 and timegrain PT1M. All timegrains and other categories will remain the same.
